abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Irrigation Subsector
            Supplemental Project for Peru were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the
            issue of capacity is critical and the scale of need is
            enormous, but appreciation of the problem is low. Water
            Users Organization (WUO) need to improve their capacity to
            plan, organize and manage their irrigation infrastructure
            and agricultural production systems, especially in a context
            of rapidly changing institutional and legal frameworks, and
            agricultural markets. In order to have a sustainable
            capacity building system that can count on reliable and
            realistic funding, it is recommended to address the
            potential role of different players in its design,
            methodologies, funding sources (water users,
            non-governmental organization (NGO), public and private
            sector, international cooperation) and other support
            mechanisms. Also, regional and local entities are expected
            to play an important role in enabling WUOs to enhance their
            capacities and effectiveness.

repnme.cdata!:
Technical and institutional modernization
            of irrigated agriculture : Peru's Irrigation Sub-sector
            Project and Irrigation Sub-sector Supplemental Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Irrigation
            Sub-sector Project and its Supplemental Project were to
            support the institutional and technical modernization of
            irrigated agriculture in La Costa. Specific goals aimed to:
            develop capacity for the decentralized management of
            irrigation systems by water user organizations (WUOs);
            reduce the role of the public sector in irrigation systems
            management; ensure cost recovery of capital investment and
            operation and maintenance of irrigation systems; and, for
            the Supplemental Project, build on the success of the first
            project to support the government's program to
            formalize water rights and improve water resources management.

9984462.trustfund:
BBFAO-BB FAO,TF021155-GTZ TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROJECT,TF022473-IRRIGATION SUBSECTOR PROJECT,TF035267-PERU - IRRIGATION SUBSECTOR,TF092643-WOMEN AGRICULTURAL PRODUCERS
            AND IRRIGATION IN THE PERUVIAN SIERRA:  EN

abstracts.cdata!:
This project paper introduces the
            following changes in the Peru Irrigation Sub-sector
            Supplemental Project and accompanying amendment to the
            project's loan agreement. The restructuring will
            revise: (a) project outcomes targets; and (b) the allocation
            of the loan proceeds between expenditure categories. In
            accordance with the request received from the Government on
            April 15, 2008, a first one year extension of the closing
            date of the loan agreement was approved by the country
            Director on May 28, 2008 in order to enable the borrower to
            complete subprojects that are currently under
            implementation. The new closing date is June 30, 2009.
            Taking into account the recently approved project extension,
            the restructuring will ensure that uncommitted funds are put
            into productive use, fully disbursing the loan at project
            closing, and that relevant outcomes are achieved. A
            reallocation of loan proceeds from civil works and goods
            categories to consultant services and operating costs will
            ensure that there are enough funds to: (a) continue
            supporting farmers preparing good quality irrigation
            improvement subproject feasibility studies and gathering
            their financial contribution; (b) ensure the sustainability
            of project investments through capacity building of water
            users associations (WUAs) and farmers in the operation and
            maintenance of the improved irrigation schemes; (c) continue
            the formalization of water rights, essential to encourage
            farmers investments, in particular in irrigation; and (d)
            continue project management activities for an additional
            year. Finally, it is proposed to revise outcome targets to
            better reflect what can be achieved by project closing.

repnme.cdata!:
Peru - Irrigation Subsector Supplemental
            Project : indigenous peoples plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The irrigation sub-sector supplemental
            project for Peru will contribute to increase the production
            and productivity of irrigated agriculture in the Peru's
            coast in order to improve the farmer's well-being and
            to contribute to poverty alleviation. To achieve this
            objective, the project will promote the development of the
            water user organizations financing and management capacity,
            the improvement in the use of the water resource and the
            increase in the soil use efficiency. Social impacts of the
            new operation will be positive. The original project has
            substantially increased crop yields and farm incomes. It
            also created over 6,000 new jobs. The project's new
            component, will helping to formalize water rights, and will
            be an additional social benefit to farmers, whose
            livelihoods in the long run are largely subject to land
            ownership and dependable water rights.

Peru - Irrigation Subsector Supplemental
            Project : indigenous peoples plan

7706394.subsc: Agricultural extension and research,Irrigation and drainage,Central government administration
7706394.sectr: Agriculture, fishing, and forestry,Public Administration, Law, and Justice
7706394.trustfund:
TF056929-BNPP-WATER: WATER RESOURCES
            MANAGEMENT PROGRAM II - (BNWPP)

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the project is to
            contribute to increase the production and productivity of
            irrigated agriculture in the Peru's Coast in order to
            improve the farmer's well-being. There is a remote
            possibility that the execution of project works may cause
            significant damage to natural resources, environmental
            preservation and conservation. Nonetheless, some of the
            environmental impacts are : damage to historic cultural
            heritage areas; use of agro-chemical products; noise, dust
            and air pollution from vehicular and construction
            activities; and potential soil erosion, destruction of
            landscape, and vegetation. Mitigation measures are :
            vehicles to comply with local municipality noise and air
            quality regulations; reject of works with pre-investment
            studies that lack environmental impact study; stop works
            whose technical drawings indicate they affect
            historic-cultural sites; organize community outreach and
            public awareness campaigns on environmental management
            issues; affected land and vegetation will be restored by
            soil leveling and covering grass; and finally; promote the
            application of adequate agronomic practices and train
            farmers in pesticide management.

display_title.display_title:
Perú – Proyecto Complementario
            del Subsector Riego (Vol. 2) : Manual operativo

repnme.cdata!:
Peru - Irrigation Subsector Project -
            Supplemental Loan

abstracts.cdata!:
The additional financing will partially
            compensate for the US$30 million, reallocated from the
            original loan for the emergency rehabilitation of irrigation
            infrastructure, damaged by the 1998 El Nino disaster. It
            aims to complete and consolidate the objectives and the
            achievements as well, of the original Irrigation Sub-sector
            Project. The Supplemental Loan is expected to benefit some
            farmers and their families, and will support the key
            components of the original Project which are expected to
            have a major incremental impact. In addition, it will help
            formalize water rights, a major move toward the adoption of
            the Water Law, an advanced version of which is currently
            under discussion by a special Congressional Committee. The
            loan would be under Fixed Spread Loan (FSL) terms, with
            eight years of grace, and a total maturity of 14 years.

docna.cdata!:
Peru - Irrigation Subsector Project -
            Supplemental Loan
